title: Non-exhaustive pattern diagnostic include #[stable(...)] annotation

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
[Given the following code](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=93b5bd1ac68c88a2f922c3c0dd38bdef)

```rust
fn foo() {
    let result = Some(1i32);
    match result {
        Some(r) if r != 0 => {}
        None => {}
    }
}
```

The current output is:

```
    Checking mystery v0.1.0 (/home/jsha/learnrust/mystery)
error[E0004]: non-exhaustive patterns: `Some(_)` not covered
   --> src/lib.rs:3:11
    |
3   |     match result {
    |           ^^^^^^ pattern `Some(_)` not covered
    |
   ::: /home/jsha/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/option.rs:518:5
    |
518 |     Some(#[stable(feature = "rust1", since = "1.0.0")] T),
    |     ---- not covered
    |
    = help: ensure that all possible cases are being handled, possibly by adding wildcards or more match arms
    = note: the matched value is of type `Option<i32>`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0004`.
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
    Checking mystery v0.1.0 (/home/jsha/learnrust/mystery)
error[E0004]: non-exhaustive patterns: `Some(_)` not covered
   --> src/lib.rs:3:11
    |
3   |     match result {
    |           ^^^^^^ pattern `Some(_)` not covered
    |
    = help: ensure that all possible cases are being handled, possibly by adding wildcards or more match arms
    = note: the matched value is of type `Option<i32>`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0004`.
error: could not compile `mystery` due to previous error
```

The `#[stable(...)]` tag is a directive for documentation, but should not be included in this diagnostic.

This bug exists for me locally in stable and nightly, installed via rustup. Oddly, it does _not_ reproduce on the playground.
